p: CHIKV ECSA also reached the southeast region of Brazil, causing large outbreaks. Increasing evidence indicates that the ECSA genotype has predominated in the Southern region, especially in Rio de Janeiro. Xavier et al. (2019) sequenced 11 near-complete CHIKV genomes from clinical samples of patients from Rio de Janeiro, and together with the whole sequencing of 2 CHIKV genomes from positive individuals by Cunha et al. (2017), during the 2016 outbreak, and 10 partially sequenced samples (CHIKV E1 gene) by Souza et al. (2017), the phylogenetic reconstructions confirmed that in Rio de Janeiro the ECSA strain is the driving force of the epidemics ( Figure 1B).
